H0.text: Cytoplasm is where DNA is located in prokaryotic cells.

H1.text: Ribosomes are where DNA is located in prokaryotic cells.

H2.text: Cytoskeleton is where DNA is located in prokaryotic cells.

H3.text: Mitochondria are not where DNA is located in prokaryotic cells.

A4.text: The nucleoid is a distinct structure and occupies a defined region of the bacterial cell.

A5.text: Bacterial chromosomes tend to be tethered to the plasma membrane of the bacteria.
